sentence.Network_en: Instead of snacking on crisps and chocolate, nibble on celery or carrot.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要把薯片和巧克力当零食来吃，要吃些芹菜和胡萝卜。

sentence.Network_en: I have a thing around celery. I can't stand it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很讨厌芹菜, 我无法忍受它(的味道).

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French céleri, from Italian dialect selleri, based on Greek selinon 'parsley'

entry.def: Celery is a vegetable with long pale green stalks. It is eaten raw in salads.

means.word_mean: 1. widely cultivated herb with aromatic leaf stalks that are eaten raw or cooked
2. stalks eaten raw or cooked or used as seasoning

sentences.en: Chop the celery and add it to the salad.
Caroline dug up a head of celery.
sentences.cn: 卡罗琳从地里挖出一棵芹菜。
